intro: Vatica nitida, commonly known as the slender ironwood, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in lowland and hill forest areas, reaching heights of up to 40 meters. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Vatica nitida plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
